intro: Alloplectus dichrous, commonly known as the two-spined spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its toxicity should be noted.
